byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Erbil, Omar Al-Jawoshy from Baghdad, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

abstract: Iraqi Shiite militias launch offensive against Islamic State in Tal Afar, Iraq, area which is close to Turkey and home to sizeable population of ethnic Turkmen.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Iraq’s Shiite militias aimed to take the city, a move that would essentially cut off the Islamic State fighters there from their bases in Syria.
snippet: Iraq’s Shiite militias aimed to take the city, a move that would essentially cut off the Islamic State fighters there from their bases in Syria....

headline.main: Tal Afar, West of Mosul, Becomes Center of Battle for Influence in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Battle for Influence in Iraq Shifts West of Mosul
